meanings.sent1: She was bucking against the new rule at school.
meanings.sent2: The horse was bucking to get the rider off its back.
meanings.sent3: The cat kept bucking against wearing the tiny hat.
meanings.sent4: The waves were bucking against the shore with great force.
meanings.sent5: The child was bucking against going to bed, pleading for just five more minutes.

meanings.definition: To throw off or dislodge something by sudden force
meanings.sent1: He was bucking the ball to his friend during the game.
meanings.sent2: The cowboy was bucking the hay bale onto the truck.
meanings.sent3: The tree was bucking the apples down with each gust of wind.
meanings.sent4: The machine was bucking the coins into the collection bin.
meanings.sent5: The chef was bucking the vegetables into the boiling water.

meanings.definition: To move in a jerky or uncontrolled manner
meanings.sent1: The old car was bucking along the bumpy road.
meanings.sent2: The rodeo bull was bucking wildly in the arena.
meanings.sent3: The robot vacuum cleaner kept bucking around the furniture.
meanings.sent4: The kite was bucking in the strong wind, soaring high in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The dancer was bucking across the stage, captivating the audience with her energy.
